page.title: 16LITTLE WITLEY CIDER GROWING
page.content: { Cider apples}are grown extensively on farms within this area. Planting has taken place during the last decade and trees are currently reaching full productivity. All are owned by H.P.Bulmer Ltd of Hereford. {Orchard management}is of a very high standard using all modern production and harvesting methods. Orchards are grassed and this is controlled by frequent mowing. Herbicide is applied to control weeds and grass in tree rows. Regular sprays of insecticide and fungicide ensure clear crops. Biennial bearing is evident, trees carry heavy crops in their "on" year and much lighter crops in their "off". {Harvesting}is by mechanical shaker, apples being then blown into windrows and finally lifted by machine into tractors and taken to collecting points for delivery to the factory.
